definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: These foods reduce the hotness and dryness.
sentences.chinese: 這些食物減少暑熱和燥。

sentences.english: Hot weather, even the airport would have been intolerable heat.
sentences.chinese: 酷熱的天氣，連機場也會感到暑熱難耐。

sentences.english: Summer substituting tea drinking also can remove the heat.
sentences.chinese: 夏天代茶飲還能清除暑熱。

sentences.english: The pavement heaved and buckled in the heat .
sentences.chinese: 人行道在暑熱中變得凹凸不平。

sentences.english: Consecutive rainy days reduce summer heat in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 連日陰雨，讓北京夏天的暑熱減去了幾分。

sentences.english: Nanjing City has been called the "stove", Jinbing many northerners are very afraid of Shure .
sentences.chinese: 南京城素有“火爐”之稱，金兵多是北方人甚怕暑熱。

sentences.english: The girl fainted in the heat but she was soon brought round.
sentences.chinese: 這個姑娘在暑熱中昏倒了，但很快就被救醒。

definition: chest and hypochondrium/upper part of the body
excess of internal heat due to poor general condition (TCM)/the prestige of another person, which one borrows for oneself
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
